intro: Monosis travancorica, commonly known as Travancore monosis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It has elliptical to ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a short, fibrous root system. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
